definition: to indulge in/to wallow/absorbed in/deeply engrossed/addicted
to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy
to drown/to indulge/addicted to/to spoil (a child)

sentences.english: Still, who wants to wallow in champagne?
sentences.chinese: 但是，誰願意沉溺於香檳啊？

sentences.english: Harry is so addicted to alcohol that he'd sell his soul for a bottle of whisky.
sentences.chinese: 沉溺於喝酒，結果他會爲一瓶威士忌而出賣靈魂的。

sentences.english: Once in a while, we tend to indulge in sheer luxury.
sentences.chinese: 我們偶爾會沉溺於那些純粹的奢侈品。

sentences.english: Constant indulgence in bad habits brought about his ruin.
sentences.chinese: 經常沉溺於惡習導致了他的毀滅。

sentences.english: Addicted to the infra-red glow of tanning salons? This word describes you.
sentences.chinese: 沉溺於皮膚曬黑沙龍的紅外光。

sentences.english: The fastest way to defeat depression is to quit drowning in self-pity.
sentences.chinese: 對付抑鬱最快速的方法就是放棄沉溺在自憐中。
沉溺在你的世界，義無反顧。

sentences.english: Let me for once feel that lost sweet touch in the allness of the universe.
sentences.chinese: 讓我一次感覺到在充實的萬物中沉溺於美好的輕觸。

sentences.english: Tell yourself that you are allowed to wallow in your self-pity for the rest of the day.
sentences.chinese: 告訴自己，你可以沉溺在你的自我爲整天都可惜。

sentences.english: I only indulged in a dream.
sentences.chinese: 我只是沉溺於一個夢而已。

sentences.english: It’s very easy to get wrapped up in things.
sentences.chinese: 沉溺在一件事裏很容易。

sentences.english: Don't get addicted to time-stealers like email and voice mail.
sentences.chinese: 不要沉溺於象電子郵件和聲訊郵件這樣的時間殺手。

sentences.english: In America, we wallow in it.
sentences.chinese: 而在美國，我們恰恰沉溺於此。

sentences.english: The write indulged in metaphorical language.
sentences.chinese: 這部作品沉溺於隱喻性的語言中。

sentences.english: Americans are being warned against indulging in an orgy of self-condemnation.
sentences.chinese: 美國人被警告不要沉溺於自我譴責的放縱之中。

sentences.english: It feels like I'm drowning in salty water.

definition: deeply immersed/fig. wallowing in/deeply engrossed in
to be engrossed/to be absorbed with/to lose oneself in/to be addicted to
to free oneself/to extricate oneself from a difficult situation
to be infatuated with/to be enchanted by/to be passionate about
to sink into (vice, depravity etc)/to pass into oblivion/downfall/passing
to fall deeper and deeper (in debt, in love etc)
to be infatuated with/to be drunk with/to be enchanted with/to revel in
